pros: The work environment is relaxed and generally there is good camaraderie among colleagues. The workspace is modern, bright and conveniently located. Supplemental work benefits are very good such as medical and dental.
cons: The leadership at RCC has been the same for close to 25 years. Compensation is fairly average; however working for an Association (a non-profit) means there is little extra funds to go around for compensation. The CEO lacks vision and promotes a dictatorial environment. Excellent talent does not stay longer than 2-3 years. RCC is a good stepping stone, not a place to make a career. If you like to fly under the radar and work strict 9-5 this is the place for you. If you're ambitious and want to learn from colleagues, look elsewhere.

pros: Compensation for work is great, benefits are unmatched and if anonymity is what you're looking for then search no more.
cons: That said, all of those things come at the price of a dictatorship. Where everyone is expendable and where the retention rate is about 1 person every 2-3 months. In the industry of retail, it is corporate suicide not to keep up with the technological advancements and necessities in marketing and customer relationship management. Instead they choose to waste money schmoozing with other C-Suite executives rather than paying any attention or any investment to the thousands of small-business members who would benefit from better curated content, an improved online experience, and a member portal who's UI design isn't from the dawn of Internet Explorer.

review_title: Amazing colleagues, but policies/goals are set for huge growth in a dying industry
pros: My colleagues are people I truly enjoy spending every day with. We have fun with one another and genuinely enjoy each others' company.
cons: The pay is not competitive, the executive team does not like to grow talent from within so career growth is extremely limited and the goals are almost never realist.
